title: Blueprint, Central Station Industry Exhibit, Century of Progress Chicago Internatioal Exposition of 1933: Living Room Windows, Sash Details, 1933
title_raw: Central Station Industry Exhibit, Century of Progress Chicago Internatioal Exposition of 1933: Living Room Windows, Sash Details
medium: blueprint and graphite on white wove paper, double ruled border
inscribed: Inscribed at center: front elevation of living room showing/arrangement of window sash; at lower right: full size detail of muntins/and mullions/ Central Station Industry Exhibit/Sash Details of Living Room/Dwg. No. 457 Scale 3/4"=1'-0"/Mar. 24, 1933/C.G. Beersman-Arch. Inscribed with dimensions, instructions, materials throughout; Inscribed in graphite with calculations on verso.
description: Blueprint for window sash details in living room of Central Station Industry Exhibit, Century of Progress Exposition, Chicago. Upper plan shows 24-pane window. On right showing 20-pane window. Plans and elevations below.

tombstone.epitaph: Blueprint, Central Station Industry Exhibit, Century of Progress Chicago Internatioal Exposition of 1933: Living Room Windows, Sash Details, 1933; Office of Donald Deskey (American, 1894–1989); USA; blueprint and graphite on white wove paper, double ruled border; 76.3 x 91.8 cm (30 1/16 x 36 1/8 in.); Gift of Donald Deskey; 1975-11-286
